project1.title: TangYuan
project1.subtitle: Exchange School Explorer & Student Community Platform
body: TangYuan is a web platform that helps students efficiently find exchange schools that match their academic background and preferences. It offers interactive map and table views, advanced eligibility filters, and a built-in community where students can share experiences, reviews, and insights—turning fragmented information into a single, reliable decision-making hub.

This mobile app was designed for a mid-sized retail company looking to expand their digital presence. The challenge was to create an intuitive shopping experience that would work seamlessly across different devices and user contexts.
• Visualizes all exchange schools on a 3D map with zooming, clickable markers, and detailed pop-up information.
• Displays schools in a structured table with multi-column sorting and filtering.
• Supports both general posts and structured school experience reviews with rating metrics
The design process followed a user-centered approach, starting with extensive user research to understand shopping behaviors and pain points.
The final design resulted in a 40% increase in mobile conversion rates and significantly improved user satisfaction scores.

project2.title: Journee
project2.subtitle: Visual Travel Itinerary Planner
body: Journee is a travel itinerary planning system that helps users organize saved places into clear, day-by-day travel plans. Instead of keeping all locations in a single Google Maps folder, users can visually arrange destinations using drag-and-drop interactions and map-based feedback, making route planning intuitive and efficient.
• View all itinerary stops on an interactive map with numbered markers showing visit order.
• Assign places to specific travel days and reorder them easily to create smooth daily routes.
• Visually group nearby locations to reduce backtracking and optimize travel flow.
The design process followed a user-centered approach, starting with extensive user research to understand shopping behaviors and pain points.
The final design resulted in a 40% increase in mobile conversion rates and significantly improved user satisfaction scores.

project3.title: ChiMei Floral
project3.subtitle: Automated Order Management System
body: ChiMei Floral is a lightweight back-office system for flower shops that turns messy customer chat messages into structured orders. By integrating a LINE Bot with the OpenAI API, the system automatically extracts key order details and stores them in a searchable database—significantly reducing manual transcription and confirmation time for shop owners.

This mobile app was designed for a mid-sized retail company looking to expand their digital presence. The challenge was to create an intuitive shopping experience that would work seamlessly across different devices and user contexts.
• Converts customer conversations into structured order data.
• Reduces repetitive manual work and minimizes human error in order handling.
• View, manage, and track all orders and customer records via a web dashboard.
The design process followed a user-centered approach, starting with extensive user research to understand shopping behaviors and pain points.
The final design resulted in a 40% increase in mobile conversion rates and significantly improved user satisfaction scores.

project4.title: Trustix
project4.subtitle: Unofficial second-hand ticket trading platform
body: This project explores the user experience of non-official secondary ticket trading. Through interviews and journey mapping with both buyers and sellers, we identified key emotional breakdown points such as information overload, trust uncertainty, and high coordination cost.

Based on these research insights, we designed a ticket trading platform featuring fan identity verification, ticket filtering and notification mechanisms, and structured face-to-face meetup coordination. A Figma prototype was created and iteratively refined through usability testing.
This platform was designed to bridge the gap between physical art galleries and digital experiences, allowing art enthusiasts to explore collections from anywhere in the world.
The design emphasizes minimalism to let the artwork speak for itself, using subtle animations and transitions to enhance the viewing experience without distraction.
The platform has attracted over 10,000 monthly visitors and received recognition for its innovative approach to digital art presentation.

project5.title: EventMate
project5.subtitle: Event Registration System
body: It is a LINE Bot with AI that consolidates event information from five universities and designed a targeted notification system to increase event visibility and user engagement. It uses the OpenAI API to deliver personalized event recommendations based on user interests stored in the CRM, boosting participation intent and event attendance rates.
EventMate was developed to solve the common challenges faced by event organizers and attendees, including complex registration processes, poor communication, and difficulty managing event details.
Built using modern web technologies with a focus on user experience and performance.
The interface was designed with simplicity and efficiency in mind, ensuring that both technical and non-technical users can easily navigate the system.
EventMate has successfully processed over 500 event registrations and received positive feedback from both organizers and attendees for its ease of use and reliability.
